to.sven.androidrccar.host.accessorycommunication.impl

Class AccessoryConnector

  • java.lang.Object
    • to.sven.androidrccar.host.accessorycommunication.impl.AccessoryConnector
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IAccessoryConnector

    public class AccessoryConnector
extends java.lang.Object
implements IAccessoryConnector
    Initializes the connection to the accessory: - Requesting permission, if need - Open accessory - Passing the opened FileDescriptor to IAccessoryCommunication. - Inform the IAccessoryConnectorListener when the IAccessoryCommunication is initialized. The class informs the listener when the accessory is disconnects.
    Author:
    sven

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private UsbAccessory accessory
      Contains the UsbAccessory if one was opened.

      If a UsbAccessory was opened, it contains the created IAccessoryCommunication.
      private IAccessoryCommunicationListener accListener
      Handles events from the accessoryCommunication.

      The intent action identifier that is used for the permission request.

      Context

      The IHostDependencyContainer
      private static java.lang.String LOG_TAG
      Used as Log Tag.
      private ParcelFileDescriptor paracelFD
      Contains the ParcelFileDescriptor that contains the InputStream and OutputStream to communicate with the µController.
      private PendingIntent permissionIntent
      The permission intent, if one is send.
      private UsbManager usbManager 
      private BroadcastReceiver usbReceiver
      Receives the answer to the requested permission or if the UsbAccessory was detached.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AccessoryConnector

        public AccessoryConnector(IHostDependencyContainer dependencyContainer)
        Creates a new AccessoryConnector. It registers the usbReceiver and calls tryOpenAccessory().
        Parameters:
        dependencyContainer - The IHostDependencyContainer

    • Method Detail

      • tryOpenAccessory

        public void tryOpenAccessory()
        Opens the accessory if there is any. If the application has not the permission to open it, the permission will be requested.
        Specified by:
        tryOpenAccessory in interface IAccessoryConnector

      • openAccessory

        private void openAccessory(UsbAccessory acc)
        Open the accessory and passing it a created IAccessoryCommunication.
        Parameters:
        acc - The UsbAccessory that should be opened.

      • close

        public void close()
        Performs final cleanups: - Closes connection to the accessory (, if there is one). - Unregisters receivers - Cancel pending intents.
        Specified by:
        close in interface IAccessoryConnector

      • closeAccessory

        private void closeAccessory()
        Closes connection to the accessory (, if there is one): - accessoryCommunication - paracelFD

      • accessoryConnected

        public boolean accessoryConnected()
        Check if any accessory is connected to the phone at the moment.
        Specified by:
        accessoryConnected in interface IAccessoryConnector
        Returns:
        True, if an accessory is connected.

      • handleError

        private void handleError(int resId,
               java.lang.Object... args)
        Something went wrong during connecting to the accessory: The listener will be informed, and #close() is called.
        Parameters:
        resId - Android String Resource id
        args - Additional arguments that will be used to format the string resource.
        See Also:
        Context#getText(int), String.format(String, Object...)
